summary: Internal email correspondence among law enforcement officials discussing the potential civil forfeiture of Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James Island. The emails debate whether to order a certified title search and appraisal, noting Epstein's ownership through corporate entities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the sole beneficial owner of Nautilus Inc and L.S.J. LLC, which hold title to Little St. James Island, the subject of potential forfeiture.

events.title: Last Deed of Record for Little St. James Island
events.description: The last recorded deed shows Nautilus Inc as holding title to Little St. James Island, with L.S.J. LLC as the previous owner.

events.title: Discussion of Forfeiture for Little St. James Island
events.description: Law enforcement officials correspond about whether to pursue civil forfeiture of Epstein's Little St. James Island, debating whether to order a certified title search and appraisal.

keyFacts: The last deed of record for Little St. James Island, dated December 23, 2011, lists Nautilus Inc as the title holder.
L.S.J. LLC was the previous owner of Little St. James Island.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the sole beneficial owner of both Nautilus Inc and L.S.J. LLC.
Law enforcement officials are considering civil forfeiture of the island but are still determining next steps as of August 2019.
The correspondence shows internal deliberation about whether to order a certified title search and appraisal for forfeiture purposes.
